intro: Garnotia khasiana var. hemitrichophylla, commonly known as the Khasi garnet, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a glossy green surface. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf venation and floral structure, which set it apart from other members of the species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
